title: How Google can predict where the next coronavirus hotspot will be
body: A US study has found a link between a spike in Google searches for certain ailments and the development of COVID-19 hotspots a month later.

title: Outdoor dining plan for Melbourne to 'transform' summer
body: The project is based on major changes made to the restaurant industry in New York City and London, where traders have moved outside onto roads and footpaths.

title: Seven deaths, 35 cases as Victoria edges closer to freedom
body: Victoria has reported 35 cases and seven deaths as the state continues to move down the road map out of lockdown.

title: Grieving daughter slams PM Scott Morrison for 'politicising' family tragedy
body: Sarah Caisip was in hotel quarantine when her father Bernard Prendergast died last week.

title: NSW records four new coronavirus cases
body: Three are in hotel quarantine and the other is linked to a known cluster.

title: Queensland's CHO says police protection has made her feel safer
body: Queensland's Chief Health Officer says the pressure of leading the state's response on the COVID-19 pandemic has taken an "enormous toll" on her as it was revealed she had to hire police to protect herself at home.

title: Mystery cases threaten easing of Victorian lockdown
body: Deputy Chief Medical Officer Dr Nick Coatsworth has warned that the 99 mystery coronavirus cases in Melbourne are the greatest threat to restrictions easing.

title: Victoria's lockdown restrictions ease
body: Regional Victoria has moved down to stage three restrictions as of midnight, while Melbourne residents also get some relief from stage four measures as of today.

title: Man jailed for eight months after two quarantine breaches within days
body: A 37-year-old ordered to self-isolate in August was caught twice in 10 days not staying inside his Perth home.

title: Woman dragged from car to be charged, police say
body: Victoria Police say they plan to charge a Melbourne woman with assaulting police after she posted a video of her arrest to social media showing her being dragged from a car by officers.

title: 'Back off': AMA calls for stop to attacks on Queensland's CMO
body: Queensland has recorded zero new cases of coronavirus in the past 24 hours, with total number of active cases standing at 30.

title: Anti-lockdown rally erupts in Melbourne
body: Victoria Police arrested 74 people and handed out 176 fines during an anti-lockdown rally that resulted in clashes between officers and protesters.

title: Victoria's $3.3b business survival package as disaster period extends
body: Victoria has extended its State of Emergency and State of Disaster for a further four weeks, and a $3.3 billion business support package has been announced.

title: Victoria records 41 new COVID-19 cases
body: Victoria has maintained its steady downward trend of daily coronavirus infections, with 41 new cases recorded in the 24 hours to 8pm last night.

title: Sydney club at risk of being shut down for COVID-19 breaches after ignoring warning
body: A raft of Sydney venues have been fined for ignoring health regulations, including one club who held a 75-person christening the day after a warning by Liquor & Gaming NSW.

title: Breaking news and updates Australia: September 13, 2020
body: Victoria extends State of Emergency, State of Disaster amid 41 new cases; Police and protesters clash as Melbourne rally erupts; Oxford coronavirus vaccine trial resumes

title: Victorian Parliament House shut down after worker's virus infection
body: Grounds at Melbourne's Parliament House are closed and deep cleaning is underway after a contracted security guard tested positive to COVID-19.

title: Qantas, Virgin, Helloworld launch public plea to lift Queensland borders
body: Australia's struggling major airlines have waded into the Queensland border dispute, launching a public campaign to lift restrictions to save the struggling tourism industry.

title: Melbourne braces for further anti-lockdown protests
body: Police have issued a stern warning to Melbourne anti-lockdown protesters after a fearsome response to an underwhelming rally yesterday.

title: Grieving mother refused exemption to attend son's funeral
body: Elena Turner lives only a few hours away from Queensland and has already lost two children in her lifetime.

title: Aussie cricketers will fly to Adelaide to train despite border rules
body: Adelaide is home to one of the world's great cricketing venues and soon it will become a hub for Australian cricketers.

title: Breaking news and updates Australia: September 12, 2020
body: Police arrest 14 at Melbourne anti-lockdown protest; Victoria records 37 new cases, six deaths; hairdressing and pet grooming to return; NSW records six cases

title: India's coronavirus cases cross 4.6m after record surge in 24 hours
body: India’s confirmed coronavirus tally has crossed 4.6 million after a record surge of 97,570 new cases in 24 hours.

title: Two children among Queensland's new cases
body: Queensland has recorded three new cases today, bringing the state's total number of COVID-19 cases to 1,149.

title: What will the office Christmas party look like in 2020?
body: There's karaoke, prizes for best dressed, bonbons and awkward dancing – but this year, the annual office Christmas party could look very different.

title: Victoria records lowest daily cases since June
body: Victoria has recorded 37 new cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the lowest daily figures since June.

title: NSW records six new cases of COVID-19
body: New South Wales has recorded six new cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours.

title: Victorian premier changes pet grooming, hairdressing, beauty services rules
body: A number of businesses in Victoria can breathe a sigh of relief, with an end to their COVID-19 lockdown to come over the next few weeks.

title: US college students test positive for coronavirus, throw party
body: A US college student house held a party at the weekend that included people who had recently tested positive for the coronavirus, according to police body camera footage.

title: Town's sports centre and pool closed after new case of COVID-19
body: A public sports centre and pool in the Blue Mounatins has been shut after a positive case of COVID-19 was detected.

title: How to spot a fraud: COVID 19 sees rise in fake online reviews
body: Some experts believe as many as 20 per cent of online reviews are fake.

title: Christmas to 'look different' with iconic tradition cancelled
body: Christmas will "look different in lots of different ways" for Victorians this year, Premier Daniel Andrews says.

title: Accused protest organiser believes COVID-19 'made by banks'
body: A failed Clive Palmer political candidate and conspiracy theorist has pledged to attend an anti-lockdown protest in Melbourne.

title: Border rule stopping nurse from being with cancer-stricken mum
body: A Victorian woman living near the South Australian border is on tenterhooks wondering if she is going to be allowed to visit her desperately ill mum.

title: Quarantine inquiry told of 'confusion' about who was in charge
body: The inquiry into Melbourne's hotel quarantine fiasco has heard that senior health officials had been confused about which department was in charge of the program.

title: Breaking news and updates Australia: September 11, 2020
body: Andrews says curfew is working, confirms different' Christmas ahead; Ten new cases in NSW; 43 new cases, nine deaths in Victoria

title: Sydneysiders to be allowed into NT as 'hotspot' status removed
body: The Northern Territory will remove its coronavirus hotspot status for Greater Sydney next month.

title: Self-help guru steps in to secure refunds for cancelled Aussie shows
body: Self-help guru Tony Robbins has stepped in to secure refunds for out-of-pocket ticket holders following the cancellation of seminars in Sydney and the Gold Coast.

title: Pics of the week: Streets burn after man dies following COVID-19 arrest
body: Violent protests, incredible sporting moments, a poignant memorial and the destruction wrought by the US wildfires are all on show in our pictures of the week gallery.

title: Dan Murphy's launches contact-free drive through in response to COVID-19
body: A direct-to-boot drive through using licence plate recognition will mean people can now pick up a bottle of wine without having to enter a store as more businesses turn to contact-free pick during the age of COVID-19.

title: Lady Pamela skipper fined $4500 for lying to border authorities
body: The skipper of the luxury yacht Lady Pamela has been fined $4500 in a Queensland court this morning for lying to border authorities.

title: Trump lashes out at journalist over coronavirus 'lie'
body: Donald Trump has lashed out at journalists after he was caught admitting to downplaying the dangers of coronavirus on tape.

title: New border testing in WA as state reaches virus landmark
body: Western Australia has gone more than 150 days without community transmission of COVID-19, with today marking five months since a locally acquired case was identified.

title: Get tested for coronavirus if you have been to these NSW venues
body: NSW Health authorities have released a list of venues that may be impacted by a coronavirus cluster.

title: Melbourne's usually packed streets remain silent as curfew drags on
body: Famous laneways, streets deserted.

title: Victoria's daily COVID-19 cases dip below 50
body: Victoria has diagnosed 43 new cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours and nine people have died.

title: Ten new coronavirus cases in NSW, six are returned travellers
body: There were 24, 760 tests in the last day, and an additional 27,135 negative tests which were not previously reported have been added to the overall tally.

title: 'I don't make those decisions': Palaszczuk hits back at PM
body: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has defended Queensland's tough border rules after a series of high-profile cases of people being denied entry.

title: Queensland records two new cases in quarantine
body: Queensland has recorded two new COVID-19 cases overnight, both in quarantine and close contacts of known cases, bringing total active cases to 28.

title: Elderly Ruby Princess passenger has spent 77 days in ICU with COVID-19
body: An elderly COVID-19 patient in Queensland has been revealed as the person who has spent the longest time in hospital of any coronavirus case in the state.
